chunks.content: To request a new class bid at Driscoll Foods, email classbidrequest@driscollfoods.com with the customer name and customer number. This creates the bid in the system for subsequent configuration.
synthetic_questions: How do I request a new class bid at Driscoll Foods?
What's the email for submitting a new class bid request with customer details?
I need to create a class bid for customer #45678—how do I start that process?
There's no button to create a new class bid in the system—what am I supposed to do?
What info do I include when emailing for a class bid so it generates in the system for config?
chunks.quality_reasoning: Core process for initiating class bids, extremely simple and direct instructions, fully actionable with minimal context needed.

jargon.class bid: A bid request for a new customer class at Driscoll Foods, initiated by emailing customer name and number to create it in the system for configuration

chunks.content: Bid File Price Maintenance: Menu 27 > Option 1. Prompt asks 'Current or Future bid? (C/F)' - enter C for current, F for future. Bid Types: CL = class bid, CU = customer bid. Enter bid number, then Down Arrow or F4 for toolbar.
synthetic_questions: How do I access Bid File Price Maintenance in the system?
What do I enter when it prompts 'Current or Future bid? (C/F)'?
After picking a CL class bid number, how do I proceed with Down Arrow or F4?
I'm stuck at Menu 27 Option 1 - it asks for C/F and I have no idea!
What's the difference between CU customer bids and CL bids in price maintenance?
chunks.quality_reasoning: Core procedure in bid management system navigation, highly actionable with clear steps, self-contained for the specific task but assumes menu access.

jargon.Bid File Price Maintenance: Menu 27 > Option 1 function for maintaining bid file prices
jargon.bid number: Identifier entered to access specific bid for maintenance
jargon.Down Arrow: Keystroke to proceed after entering bid number

chunks.content: Bid toolbar: A = Add new item to bid. C = Maintain/update existing item pricing. Access toolbar via F4 or Down Arrow after entering bid number.
synthetic_questions: How do I add a new item to a bid?
What does the 'C' option do on the bid toolbar?
How do I update pricing for an existing item in a bid?
I entered the bid number but can't see the toolbar options—what's wrong?
After entering a bid number, what keys access the bid toolbar for maintenance?
chunks.quality_reasoning: Core bid maintenance process, simple keyboard shortcuts, self-contained with clear access method and actions

jargon.Bid toolbar: A user interface toolbar for bid management, providing options like A (Add new item) and C (Maintain/update existing item pricing), accessed via F4 or Down Arrow after entering bid number
jargon.bid number: Unique identifier required to access the bid toolbar

chunks.content: Bid locking options: L = Lock prices for current week or future dates. R = Reserve lock (ideal for percent-based items like weekly produce). Unlocked bids auto-update when buyers change prices. Use R for items priced as percentages that change weekly.
synthetic_questions: What does the L option do in bid locking?
When should I use R for reserve lock on bids?
Why are my bid prices auto-updating every time the buyer changes them?
For percent-based items like weekly produce, which bid lock should I pick?
What happens if I leave bids unlocked and buyers update prices?
chunks.quality_reasoning: Core to bid pricing process in procurement; explains specific lock options L/R clearly with usage advice; straightforward for basic users, self-contained, directly guides bid management actions.

acronyms.L: Lock prices for current week or future dates

jargon.bid locking options: Options to lock bid prices (L for standard lock, R for reserve lock)
jargon.Reserve lock: Lock ideal for percent-based items like weekly produce
jargon.percent-based items: Items priced as percentages that change weekly
jargon.Unlocked bids: Bids that auto-update when buyers change prices

chunks.content: After changing bid pricing, press U in toolbar to update all already-entered orders with future delivery dates. This pushes the new pricing to orders that were entered before the price change.
synthetic_questions: How do I update existing orders after changing bid pricing?
What do I need to do after modifying bid prices so they apply to already-entered orders?
After changing bid pricing, how do I push new prices to pre-entered orders with future delivery dates?
I changed the bid pricing but old orders aren't updating—what's the step I'm missing?
Does pressing U in the toolbar after a bid pricing change only affect already-entered orders with future deliveries?
chunks.quality_reasoning: Core bid pricing process step, specific to post-change updates, simple and direct instruction that's self-contained and immediately usable.

jargon.bid pricing: Pricing set specifically for bids in the order management system
jargon.toolbar: Graphical user interface bar containing shortcut keys and commands like 'U' for update
jargon.already-entered orders: Orders previously input into the system prior to the pricing change
jargon.future delivery dates: Scheduled delivery dates occurring after the current date

chunks.content: Bid items appear as blue text with a red 'B' indicator when searching in the Alpha during order entry. This confirms the item is on the customer's active bid.

chunks.quality_reasoning: Core indicator for bid items in order entry process, simple and self-contained visual confirmation

jargon.Bid items: Items included on a customer's active bid, displayed as blue text with a red 'B' indicator
jargon.Alpha: Alphabetical search index or module used during order entry
jargon.order entry: Process of inputting customer orders into the system
jargon.active bid: Current, valid bid or quote from the customer

chunks.content: Copy class bid: Menu 27 > 1 > C (current) > CL > enter source bid number > F4 to end > type COPY > enter destination customer/bid number.

chunks.quality_reasoning: Core business process for bid copying, specific procedural steps, self-contained and highly actionable with basic system familiarity

jargon.Copy class bid: Procedure to copy a class bid from one customer/bid to another
jargon.destination customer/bid number: Customer or bid identifier to copy to
jargon.F4 to end: Function key press to conclude input sequence

chunks.content: Copy call sheet to bid: Menu 27 > 1 > C (current) > CU > enter customer number > Down Arrow > type COPY > enter destination bid number in NEW CUSTOMER/CLASS field.

jargon.call sheet: Document or record associated with customer calls or orders
jargon.bid: Proposal, quote, or job identifier in the system
jargon.CU: System menu option for copy or customer update function
jargon.NEW CUSTOMER/CLASS field: Designated input field for specifying new customer or class details
